meanings.definition: A white pigment consisting of a mixture of barium sulfate and zinc sulfide.
meanings.sent1: The artist used lithopone to create a bright white color in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The walls were painted with lithopone to give them a clean and fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child accidentally spilled lithopone all over the floor, turning it into a snowy mess.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as radiant as lithopone, lighting up the room with its pure whiteness.
meanings.sent5: The bride's dress shimmered like lithopone under the sunlight, dazzling everyone at the wedding.

meanings.sent1: She decided to lithopone the fence to make it look new again.
meanings.sent2: The laundry detergent contained a special ingredient to lithopone the clothes and remove stains.
meanings.sent3: The chef lithoponed the sauce, making it look extra creamy and delicious.
meanings.sent4: His smile lithoponed his face, brightening up the room with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The snow lithoponed the landscape, covering everything in a blanket of white.
